result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Niya L Russell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Niya L Russell in court.  Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court for Niya L Russell.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference. 
Defense counsel has received discovery and has not received an offer from the state. Defense counsel informed the Court that the defendant has pending felony matter 20CF598 in Branch 11.
Defense requests status date to determine case posture.
Case adjourned to Branch 13.
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Niya L Russell in court.  Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court for Niya L Russell.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Pretrial conference held. Attorney Lamke was recently appointed and needs discovery. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Triggiano, Branch 13.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 13.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
